item.title: Small Static Java Web Servers with GraalVM and Gradle
item.description: GraalVM is a new virtual machine from Oracle that supports several popular programming languages including JavaScript, Python, Ruby, and Java. One exciting feature of GraalVM is the ability to create native binaries from JVM binaries. These native binaries promise improved size, speed, startup time, and operational overhead compared to the typical Java runtime. In this blog post, I show how to create a native binary for a basic web server written using Spark, a popular Java microframework.
